info.title: REST API
info.description: REST-like API provides access to rich Zerion ecosystem.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a portfolio balance chart for a wallet.
This is over a specified time period, based on the provided start and end timestamps. 
Results can be filtered by blockchain and asset type, offering flexible and detailed visualizations of wallet performance, similar to what you see in the Zerion interface. 

Note: We do not support historical protocol positions data.

parameters.name: chart_period
parameters.description: Chart period

parameters.name: filter[chain_ids]
parameters.description: Account only for balance on these chains. Available chain ids can be found in chains endpoints.

parameters.name: filter[fungible_ids]
parameters.description: Account only for balance of given fungible assets.

200.description: Resource for the requested wallet chart

items.description: Chart point - tuple of two items, the first one is timestamp, the second one is a balance in requested currency

get.description:
This endpoint returns the portfolio overview of a web3 wallet.

If the address was not added before it is possible that this endpoint will return `202` status. It means that portfolio for the wallet is not prepared yet, but will be available soon. In that case the client have to request this endpoint periodically, while `200` status wasn't returned.

> NOTE: Don't forget to stop retries after some reasonable period of time. If the `200` status is not returned within 2 minutes it most probably means that some unexpected error occurred and the client should stop the polling.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

This endpoint returns a list of transactions associated with the wallet.

This endpoint supports testnets. To get data for testnets use `X-Env` header.

> NOTE: This endpoint supports a lot of filters, sorting, and pagination parameters. Make sure that your request URL length is safe for your platform. Usually, 2000 characters are the safe limit in virtually any combination of client and server software.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of the wallet.

parameters.name: filter[search_query]
parameters.description: Query for a full-text search.

parameters.name: filter[operation_types]
parameters.description: Return only transactions with specified types.

parameters.name: filter[asset_types]
parameters.description: Return only transactions that contain specified asset types.

parameters.name: filter[chain_ids]
parameters.description: Return only transactions from specified chains. You can find available chain ids in chain endpoints.

parameters.name: filter[fungible_ids]
parameters.description: Return only transactions with fungibles with specified ids.

parameters.name: filter[min_mined_at]
parameters.description: Return only transactions since specific date. Timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter[max_mined_at]
parameters.description: Return only transactions until specific date. Timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter[trash]
parameters.description: Filter transactions based on the `is_trash` flag. If no flag is specified, then `no_filter` is applied.

parameters.name: X-Env
parameters.description: Custom header that allows to get data for testnets.

get.summary: Get a list of a wallet's NFT positions
get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of the NFT positions held by a specific wallet.

If the wallet address has not been previously added, this endpoint may return a `202` status code. This indicates that the wallet's positions are not yet available, but will be in the near future. In this case, the client should periodically request this endpoint until a `200` status code is returned.

> NOTE: It is important to stop retrying after a reasonable period of time. If a `200` status code is not returned within 2 minutes, it is likely that an unexpected error has occurred and the client should stop polling.

> NOTE: This endpoint provides support for filters, sorting, and pagination parameters. Ensure that the length of the request URL falls within a safe range for your platform. Typically, a length of 2000 characters is a safe limit for most combinations of client and server software.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

parameters.name: filter[chain_ids]
parameters.description: Keep only positions from the specified chains. Available chains IDs can be found in chains endpoint.

parameters.name: filter[collections_ids]
parameters.description: Keep only positions from collections with specified IDs. The IDs are returned inside the 'collection' field of each NFT.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order of NFTs in the result.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Array of related resources to be included to the response. This parameter corresponds to the JSON API schema.

200.description: Response for requested list of NFT positions.

get.summary: Get a list of NFT collections held by a wallet
get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of the NFT collections held by a specific wallet.

If the wallet address has not been previously added, this endpoint may return a `202` status code. This indicates that the wallet's collections are not yet available, but will be in the near future. In this case, the client should periodically request this endpoint until a `200` status code is returned.

> NOTE: It is important to stop retrying after a reasonable period of time. If a `200` status code is not returned within 2 minutes, it is likely that an unexpected error has occurred, and the client should stop polling.

> NOTE: This endpoint provides support for filters, sorting. Ensure that the length of the request URL falls within a safe range for your platform. Typically, a length of 2000 characters is a safe limit for most combinations of client and server software.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

parameters.name: filter[chain_ids]
parameters.description: Keep only collections from the specified chains. Available chain IDs can be found in the chains endpoint.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Array of related resources to be included to the response. This parameter corresponds to the JSON API schema.

200.description: Response for requested list of NFT collections.

202.description: Request accepted, but NFT collections held by the wallet are still being aggregated.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the NFT portfolio overview of a web3 wallet.

If the address was not added before it is possible that this endpoint will return `202` status. It means that portfolio for the wallet is not prepared yet, but will be available soon. In that case the client have to request this endpoint periodically, while `200` status wasn't returned.

> NOTE: Don't forget to stop retries after some reasonable period of time. If the `200` status is not returned within 2 minutes it most probably means that some unexpected error occurred and the client should stop the polling.

This endpoint returns a paginated list of fungible assets supported by Zerion. It also provides the ability to search for fungibles. 
If no fungible assets are found for given filters, the empty list with 200 status is returned.

> NOTE: This endpoint supports a lot of filters, sorting, and pagination parameters. Ensure your request URL length is within a safe range for your platform. Usually, 2000 characters are the safe limit in virtually any combination of client and server software.

> NOTE: The `filter[implementation_address]` parameter ignores `filter[search_query]`. It may be changed in the future.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

parameters.name: filter[search_query]
parameters.description: Query for a full-text search.

parameters.name: filter[implementation_chain_id]
parameters.description: Keep only fungibles from this chain. Available chain ids can be found in chains endpoints.

parameters.name: filter[implementation_address]
parameters.description: Keep only fungibles deployed at given address. Is it possible that different fungibles are deployed at the same address on different chains.

parameters.name: filter[fungible_ids]
parameters.description: Keep only fungibles with the given ids

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Choose how the result should be ordering

200.description: Response for requested list of fungibles

get.description: This endpoint returns a fungible asset by unique identifier

parameters.name: fungible_id
parameters.description: Unique fungible ID

get.summary: Get a chart for a fungible asset
get.description: This endpoint returns the chart for the fungible asset for a selected period

parameters.name: fungible_id
parameters.description: Unique fungible ID

get.description:
This endpoint returns list of all chains supported by Zerion.

This endpoint supports testnets. To get data for testnets use `X-Env` header.

parameters.name: X-Env
parameters.description: Custom header that allows to get data for testnets.

200.description: Response for requested list of chains

get.description:
This endpoint returns chain by unique chain identifier.

This endpoint supports testnets. To get data for testnets use `X-Env` header.

parameters.name: chain_id
parameters.description: Unique chain ID

parameters.name: X-Env
parameters.description: Custom header that allows to get data for testnets.

get.description: The endpoint provides a list of fungibles available for bridge exchange. This endpoint is specifically designed for situations where the input and output chains are different.

chain_id.description: Initial chain id the user want exchange fungibles from. If nothing specified then `ethereum` is used.
Target chain id the user want receive fungibles on. If nothing specified then `ethereum` is used.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction parameter is a parameter that determines the flow of fungibles involved in the transaction. It can have three possible values: 'input', 'output', or 'both'. The value 'input' indicates that the API endpoint will only return fungibles that the user can send. The value 'output' indicates that the API endpoint will only return fungibles that the user can receive. The value 'both' means that the API endpoint will return fungibles which are 'input' and 'output' at the same time. In other words - intersection for 'input' and output'. If nothing specified then `both` is used.

get.description: The endpoint offers a comprehensive overview of relevant trades and bridge exchanges. A bridge exchange refers to the transfer of cryptocurrencies between different blockchain networks, while a trade pertains to an exchange of cryptocurrencies within the same network. In an effort to secure the optimal exchange rate for our users, our system sends requests to multiple exchange providers. Zerion only charges a commission fee of 0.5% on L2 and alternative L1 trades, which can be waived by obtaining our Genesis NFT. Our platform has the advantage of being an aggregator of various exchanges, ensuring that users will always get the best exchange rates available. Please note that due to the nature of the multiple requests and calculations involved, it is normal for this endpoint to have a relatively long timeout. You can expect a response time of around 5-10 seconds.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Information about what the wallet wants to send.

from.description: Address of the wallet which wants to trade or bridge. Could be omitted if only rate needed.

chain_id.description: Initial chain ID the user want exchange assets from.

fungible_id.description: Fungible ID which user wants to send. Interchangeable with asset_address.

asset_address.description: Asset address which user wants to send. Interchangeable with fungible_id for fungibles. For the base asset there is no address. Use `0xeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee` instead.

amount.description: Input asset amount in lowest units

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Information about what the wallet wants to receive.

to.description: Specifies the recipient of the assets being exchanged. If this parameter is not provided, the assets will be sent to the sender's own wallet address. Used for bridge exchanges only.

chain_id.description: Target chain ID the user want receive assets on.

fungible_id.description: Fungible ID which user wants to receive. Interchangeable with asset_address.

asset_address.description: Asset address which user wants to receive. Interchangeable with fungible_id for fungibles. For the base asset there is no address. Use `0xeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee` instead.

amount.description: Input asset amount in lowest units

parameters.name: gas_price
parameters.description: Gas price in wei. If nothing specified then current market classic gas price is used.

parameters.name: liquidity_source_id
parameters.description: The source to be used for exchanges search. If nothing specified then `all` is used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order of output transactions result. If nothing specified then `amount` is used.

parameters.name: slippage_percent
parameters.description: Maximum slippage value for the transaction to be approved. Slippage is a term used in crypto exchanges to describe the difference between the expected price of a trade and the actual price at which the trade is executed. It occurs due to the volatility and liquidity of the market, and can result in a higher or lower price than expected. If nothing specified then `2` is used.

parameters.name: integrator
parameters.description: Integrator service related parameters.

fee_percent.description: Parameter for trades on Layer-2 and alternative Layer-1 networks that allows integrators to add an additional fee for transaction, measured in percents. Integrators must also specify the address of the wallet that will receive the additional fee using the integrator[beneficiary] parameter If nothing specified then `0` is used..

beneficiary.description: Parameter that integrator uses to specify the address of the wallet to receive additional fee associated with the transaction. This parameter is used in conjunction with the integrator[fee] parameter, which allows integrators to specify an additional fee for the exchange. Works only for trades on Layer-2 chains and alternative Layer-1 chains.

get.summary: Get list of all available gas prices
get.description: This endpoint provides real-time information on the current gas prices across all supported blockchain networks. Gas prices play a crucial role in the speed and cost of executing transactions on a blockchain, and fluctuate frequently based on network demand and usage. By using this endpoint, developers can stay up-to-date with the latest gas prices and adjust their application's transaction parameters accordingly to ensure optimal speed and cost efficiency.

parameters.name: filter[chain_ids]
parameters.description: Return only gas prices from specified chains. You can find available chain ids in chain endpoints.

parameters.name: filter[gas_types]
parameters.description: Return only gas prices with specified gas-type.

get.description:
This endpoint returns list of NFTs by using different parameters.

It returns NFTs of both types - ERC721 and ERC1155.

> NOTE: Consider all IDs as abstract strings, without making any assumptions about their format or relying on such assumptions. There is a non-zero probability that IDs may change in the future, and this should not result in any breaking changes.

parameters.name: filter[references]
parameters.description:
Keep only NFTs matching specified references.

Reference format is `chain_id:contract_address:token_id`. 

References should be separated by comma `,`.

`chain_id`- ID of the chain where NFT exists, can be found in /chains endpoint.

`contract_address` address of the deployed contract which NFT belongs to.

`token_id` id of the NFT withing specified `contract_address`.

NOTE: parameter currently is mandatory and can not be omitted.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Array of related resources to be included to the response. This parameter corresponds to the JSON API schema.

get.description: This endpoint returns single NFT by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: nft_id
parameters.description: NFT unique identifier

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Array of related resources to be included to the response. This parameter corresponds to the JSON API schema.

detail.example: Some validation errors will be described here
The API key is invalid, please, make sure that you are using a valid key

TransactionsListResponse.description: Response for requested list of transactions

WalletNFTPositionsProcessingResponse.description: Request accepted, but NFT positions are still being aggregated.

NFTPortfolioProcessingResponse.description: Request accepted, but nft portfolio is still being aggregated

detail.example: Requested resource was not found, try later

SingleFungibleChartResponse.description: Resource for the requested fungible chart

SwapFungiblesResponse.description: Response for requested list available for bridge fungibles.

NFTsResponse.description: Response for requested list of NFTs

Currency.name: currency
Currency.description: Denominated currency value of returned prices

after.description:
This field is used for result pagination. You SHOULD NOT use this parameter directly. 
To get the next page of the results you should use `links.next` field. 
Omit it to return the first page.

size.description: Set maximum number of items per a page in the pagination.

WalletNFTCollectionsSort.name: sort
WalletNFTCollectionsSort.description: The order of NFTs in the result.

WalletPortfolioTotal.description: Total portfolio values across all wallet positions and NFT

wallet.description: Total value of asset on the wallet in selected currency

deposited.description: Total value of deposited assets in selected currency

borrowed.description: Total value of borrowed assets in selected currency

locked.description: Total value of locked assets in selected currency

staked.description: Total value of staked assets in selected currency

additionalProperties.description: Total value of asset on the chain in selected currency

name.description: Displayable name of the fungible fungible.

symbol.description: Displayable symbol of the fungible fungible.

description.example: The BED index is meant to track cryptos top 3 investab...

implementations.description: Implementation details of the fungible on various chains.

sender.description: Address of the sender of the approval.

name.description: Human readable representation of DApp, that wallet interacted to. That offers more intuitive understanding for users.

contract_address.description: The address of the executed contract.

id.description: Execution method id. First 4 bytes of keccak256 of method signature in hex format.

name.description: Human readable name of the method.

mined_at_block.description: Number of a block where the transaction was mined.

mined_at.description: Timestamp string in ISO 8601 format when the transaction was mined.

sent_from.description: Address of a sender of the transaction. It could be a smart contract address too.

sent_to.description: Address of a recipient of the transaction. It could a be smart contract address too.

transfers.description: List of transfers. An empty list is returned if the transaction does not have any transfers.

approvals.description: List of approvals. An empty list is returned if the transaction does not have any approvals.

is_trash.description: Is the transaction classified by Zerion as trash.

verified.description: Whether this fungible verified or not

decimals.description: Number of decimals points of the implementation.

allOf.description: The URL of the preview image
The URL of the full-size image
The URL of the audio file
The URL of the video file

NFTInterfaceEnum.description: The standard that the NFT contract follows, e.g. ERC-721.

contract_address.description: Address of the contract of the NFT.

token_id.description: Unique identifier of the NFT inside the contract.

is_spam.description: Indicates whether the NFT spam or not.

int.description: The integral representation of the quantity (123.45678 -> 12345678).

decimals.description: Decimal number precision of the quantity - digits after the floating point.

TransactionFee.description: The fee that was paid for the transaction.

price.description: Price of the asset when the transaction was mined.

value.description: The fee value in requested currency.
Value of the transfer in requested currency.

sender.description: Address of the sender of the transfer.

recipient.description: Address of the recipient of the transfer.

changed_at.description: The date and the time when the position was updated in ISO format.

amount.description: The quantity of the NFT position.

price.description: The lowest price (floor) of the position's NFT. Measured in the requested currency.

value.description: The lowest value of the NFT position (floor). Measured in the requested currency.

WalletNFTPositionContainer.description: The NFT position of the wallet.

allOf.description: The blockchain on which the NFT position exists.
The NFT which represents the position.
The NFT collection which the NFT belongs to.

min_changed_at.description: The earliest `changed_at` date and time alongside all wallet's positions from the collection.

max_changed_at.description: The most recent `changed_at` date and time alongside all wallet's positions from the collection.

nfts_count.description: The total quantity of the wallet's NFT positions from the collection.

total_floor_price.description: The lowest price (floor) of the all wallet's NFTs positions from the collection. Measured in the requested currency.

WalletNFTCollectionContainer.description: The NFT collection held by the wallet.

chains.description: The blockchain on which the NFT collection exists.

allOf.description: The NFT collection itself.

NFTContainerAttributes.description: Represents attributes of a non-fungible token (NFT) corresponding to JSON API specification.

contract_address.description: The address of the contract that manages the NFT.

token_id.description: The unique identifier for the NFT within its contract.

NFTContainerRelationships.description: Represents relationships of a non-fungible token (NFT) corresponding to JSON API specification.

allOf.description: The blockchain on which the NFT exists.
The collection that the NFT belongs to.

key.description:
Attribute key. The key is not unique and is it possible to have several attributes
with the same key.

last_sale.description: Information about last sale of the NFT.

price.description: The last known sale price of the NFT in the currency specified in the request parameters.

allOf.description: The quantity of the NFT in the last sale.

NFTMarketDataPrices.description: The prices associated with the NFT expressed in the currency specified in the request parameters.

floor.description: The lowest known price for the NFT.

tags.description: The list of tags associated with the NFT

attributes.description: The list of attributes associated with the NFT

NFTCollectionContainerAttributes.description: Represents an NFT collection attributes corresponding to JSON API specification.

NFTCollectionMarketData.description: Contains marketplace data for a collection of NFTs.

NFTCollectionMarketDataPrices.description: Prices associated with the NFT collection expressed in the currency specified in the request parameters.

floor.description: The lowest known price for an NFT in the collection.

payment_token_symbol.description: The symbol for the payment token used by the collection.

NFTCollectionInfo.description: Represents an NFT collection short info.

allOf.description: The URL for the collection's icon.
The URL for the collection's banner image.

arbitrum.description: Total value of NFTs on arbitrum chain in selected currency

aurora.description: Total value of NFTs on aurora chain in selected currency

avalanche.description: Total value of NFTs on avalanche chain in selected currency

binance-smart-chain.description: Total value of NFTs on bsc chain in selected currency

ethereum.description: Total value of NFTs on ethereum chain in selected currency

fantom.description: Total value of NFTs on fantom chain in selected currency

loopring.description: Total value of NFTs on loopring chain in selected currency

optimism.description: Total value of NFTs on optimism chain in selected currency

polygon.description: Total value of NFTs on polygon chain in selected currency

solana.description: Total value of NFTs on solana chain in selected currency

xdai.description: Total value of NFTs on xdai chain in selected currency

additionalProperties.description: Total value of NFTs in selected currency on specified chain.

description.example: The BED index is meant to track cryptos top 3 investab...

implementations.description: Implementation details of the fungible on various chains.

fully_diluted_valuation.description: Total market capitalization of fungible in selected currency

market_cap.description: Circulating market capitalization of fungible in selected currency

percent_1d.description: Price relative change in percent for 1 day

percent_30d.description: Price relative change in percent for 30 days

percent_90d.description: Price relative change in percent for 90 days

percent_365d.description: Price relative change in percent for 1 year

items.description: Chart point - tuple of two items, the first one is timestamp, the second one is a price in requested currency

token_url_format.description: URL with placeholders that leads to a token page

tx_url_format.description: URL with placeholders that points to a transaction page

home_url.description: URL leads to the explorer homepage

supports_trading.description: Whether trading is supported on Zerion for this chain or not

supports_sending.description: Whether sending is supported on Zerion for this chain or not

supports_bridge.description: Whether bridges are supported on Zerion for this chain or not

internal_server_url_format.description: URL with placeholders of RPC server which can be used for project purposes

public_servers_url.description: List of URL of public RPC servers which can be used by everyone

preconditions_met.description: Indicates whether the wallet meets necessary preconditions for the transaction to be successfully completed.

enough_allowance.description: Indicates whether the wallet has authorized sufficient asset for the swap (True) or not (False).

enough_balance.description: Indicates whether the wallet has enough assets for the swap (True) or not (False).

allOf.description: The maximum amount of the asset the wallet will be charged.
The minimum amount of the asset the wallet will receive considering slippage.
The estimated amount of the asset being sent by the wallet.
The estimated amount of the asset the wallet will receive.

gas.description: The estimated amount of gas required for a transaction.

seconds.description: The estimated time it will take for the output asset to be delivered to the user's wallet. Used only for bridge transactions, `0` otherwise.

id.description: The unique identifier of the liquidity source being used for the exchange.

name.description: The name of the liquidity source.

allOf.description: The URL of the icon representing the liquidity source.

asset_spender.description: The address of the contract to which approval must be given. Approval is not needed for the base currency (for example ETH on ethereum chain). `null` when allowance is not required

slippage_type.description: The type of slippage. Possible values are 'normal' and 'zero-slippage'.

transaction.description: An object representing a transaction that is to be signed by a wallet and to be sent to the blockchain. `null` if balance or allowance is not enough.

to.description: The address that the transaction is to be sent to, formatted in checksummed.

from.description: The address that the transaction is to be signed by, formatted in checksummed format.

chain_id.description: The ID of the blockchain network, represented in hexadecimal format.

gas.description: The amount of gas to be supplied for the transaction, which is set to be 15% higher than the estimation.

data.description: The data to be used as input for the transaction, represented in hexadecimal format.

value.description: The amount of the blockchain's native asset to be sent with the transaction, represented in smaller units (wei).

base_percent.description: The Zerion fee without a fee waiver, expressed as a percentage.

percent.description: The Zerion fee after considering the user's fee waiver, expressed as a percentage.

allOf.description: The Zerion fee after considering the user's fee waiver, taken of the output asset.

percent.description: The fee charged by the integrator, expressed as a percentage.

allOf.description: The fee charged by the integrator, taken of the output asset.
The source chain which the wallet wants to trade from.
The fungible asset which the user wants to send during the trade.

output_chain.description: The target chain the wallet wants to receive assets.

output_fungible.description: The fungible asset which the user wants to receive during the trade.

base_fee.description: The base fee is an algorithmically determined amount of gas that is required for a transaction to be included in a block. It is dynamically adjusted based on network demand and burned whenever a transaction is included in a block.

allOf.description: Object that stores information about the gas price for a slow transaction.
Object that stores information about the gas price for a slow transaction.
Object that stores information about the gas price for a rapid transaction.
Object that stores information about the gas price for a standard transaction.

priority_fee.description: The suggested gas price (in wei) that you are willing to pay in order to ensure acceptance of your transaction.

max_fee.description: The suggested upper limit for the gas price (in wei) that you are willing to pay in order to ensure acceptance of your transaction.

estimation_seconds.description: An estimation of the time, measured in seconds, required for a transaction to be confirmed on the blockchain.

slow.description: The gas price for a slow transaction.

standard.description: The gas price for a standard transaction.

fast.description: The gas price for a fast transaction.

rapid.description: The gas price for a rapid transaction.

l1.description: The total cost of submitting a transaction to Ethereum. This cost is incurred in addition to the L2 execution fee and is typically the primary cost component of a transaction on Optimism.

l2.description: The cost of computation and storage used in executing a transaction on Layer 2. This is equivalent to the gas used multiplied by the gas price attached to the transaction.

fixed_overhead.description: A fixed overhead cost denominated in gas that is included in the L1 data fee calculation. This value is currently set to 2100 and does not vary based on the size or complexity of the transaction.

dynamic_overhead.description: A dynamic overhead cost that scales the L1 fee paid by a fixed number. This value is currently set to 1.0 and is included in the L1 data fee calculation. The L1 gas price used to charge the data fee is automatically updated when new data is received from Ethereum, which may result in users paying a higher or lower than estimated L1 data fee by up to 25%.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the price was updated in ISO format.

allOf.description: Object that stores gas prices in classic format.
Object that stores gas prices under the EIP-1559 proposal: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559
Object that stores information related to gas prices on the Optimism blockchain.

NFTCollectionContainerAttributesNoMarket.description: Represents an NFT collection attributes corresponding to JSON API specification.
